About Me

DevOps engineer turned AI platform architect, building the future of enterprise automation.

My Story

I'm Muhammad Usman Ramzan, a Senior DevOps Engineer and CTO at Urnlabs, where I lead the technical strategy for enterprise AI agent platforms. My journey in technology spans from traditional infrastructure management to pioneering the next generation of autonomous workflow systems.

What I Do

As CTO at Urnlabs, I architect and implement governance-first AI agent platforms that enterprises can trust. My focus is on building deterministic workflows with comprehensive observability, policy enforcement, and measurable ROI.

I specialize in multi-cloud Kubernetes platforms, having designed and deployed production systems on EKS, OKE, and RKE2. My approach emphasizes security-first architecture with zero-trust principles and compliance-ready frameworks.

Technical Expertise

  • Cloud Platforms: AWS, Azure, GCP, Oracle Cloud
  • Container Orchestration: Kubernetes, Docker, Helm
  • Infrastructure as Code: Terraform, Pulumi, CloudFormation
  • CI/CD: GitLab CI, GitHub Actions, Jenkins, ArgoCD
  • Monitoring & Observability: Prometheus, Grafana, ELK Stack, Jaeger
  • Service Mesh: Istio, Linkerd
  • Security: Policy-as-Code, RBAC, Zero-Trust Architecture

Current Focus

I'm passionate about bridging the gap between traditional DevOps practices and modern AI automation needs. This involves:

  • Designing deterministic AI agent workflows with DAG-based orchestration
  • Implementing real-time governance and policy enforcement systems
  • Building comprehensive evaluation and telemetry frameworks
  • Creating enterprise-grade security controls for AI workloads

Philosophy

I believe in "governance-first" architecture - building systems where compliance, security, and observability are not afterthoughts but fundamental design principles. In the AI era, this means creating platforms that are both powerful and trustworthy, with clear audit trails and measurable outcomes.

Beyond Work

When I'm not architecting cloud infrastructure or speaking at conferences, you'll find me exploring new developments in the cloud-native ecosystem, contributing to open source projects, or mentoring the next generation of DevOps engineers.

Career Timeline

CTO, Urnlabs

2023 - Present

Leading technical strategy for enterprise AI agent platforms. Architecting governance-first infrastructure with deterministic workflows and comprehensive observability.

Senior DevOps Engineer
